Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in declaring claims abandoned despite evidence of intent to pursue

Defendant_Behavior: Board declared claims abandoned without considering medical evidence or alternatives
Grounds_for_Claim: Procedural unfairness, failure to consider evidence of intent
Legal_Standard: Reasonable opportunity to be heard under Section 69.1(6)
Assessment_Factor: Medical evidence, claimant intent, procedural fairness
Procedural_Issue: Failure to provide reasonable opportunity to be heard
Evidence_Used: Medical evidence, actions indicating intent to pursue claims
Application_Basis: Intent to pursue claims despite non-appearance
Relief_Sought: Overturn of abandonment decision, referral for new hearing
Governing_Rule: Board must not fetter discretion and must consider all relevant evidence
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Board ignored available medical and behavioral evidence
Outcome: Decision overturned, case remanded for full hearing
Decisional_Body: Refugee Division of the Immigration and Refugee Board
Harm_Assessment: Prejudice to claimants' right to fair refugee determination process
Cause_Description: Applicants missed hearings due to medical conditions and anxiety, leading the Board to declare claims abandoned
Evidence_Handling: Board failed to properly consider submitted medical evidence
Evidence_Issues: Disregard of relevant medical and circumstantial evidence
